before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"1jvj","text":"Place 1 sterile 15ml falcon tube on ice per snail to be shed","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6p9qu","text":"Pre-chill benchtop centrifuge to 4°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ds7h6","text":"Prepare 1x DPBS+2% anti-anti and place in 37°C reciprocating water bath (see recipes in \"MATERIALS\" section)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnoq2","text":"Prepare somule media and place in 37°C reciprocating water bath (see recipes in \"MATERIALS\" section)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5n56r","text":"Prepare somule wash and place in 37°C reciprocating water bath (see recipes in \"MATERIALS\" section)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dds16","text":"Free-living aquatic S. mansoni cercariae transform into the first intramammalian stage,called schistosomula or somules, by burrowing in the host skin. Upon contact, cercariae begin to enter the skin and lose their tails, becoming schistosomula. Somules migrate through the epidermis to the dermis to find a small venule or lymphatic vessel to enter the vasculature.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bp8lr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ojn6","text":"Transformation of cercariae to schistosomula can be mimicked in the laboratory by triturating cercariae to remove tails, eliminating tails in a percoll gradient, and then culturing the somules in somule media. This method is used when the number of cercariae is high as the percoll gradient results in loss of cercariae. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jge6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ape2o","text":"Somules can be cultured for several weeks with regular media changes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ld1a","text":"Media changes and opening of transformed somules to take place in tissue culture hood using sterile techniques","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

references.title: Cultivation of Schistosoma mansoni In vitro. I. Establishment of Cultures from Cercariae and Development until Pairing

related_materials.name: 3ml Sterile Graduated Transfer Pipets individually wrapped
BD PlastiPak Syringe with Luer Lock
Laboratory pipetting needle with 90° blunt ends 22G L 1 1/2 in.
1000 mL Vacuum Filter/Storage Bottle System 0.22 µm Pore 54.5cm² PES Membrane Sterile 12
Corning Cell Culture Treated Flasks with Vent Cap

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4bohv","text":"Shed cercariae from snails in a 6-well plate (see protocol \"Schistosoma mansoni cercariae shedding\"). The snails can be shed for up to 2 hrs by collecting cercariae and replacing with fresh water every 30 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"json","text":"Using a sterile transfer pipette, dispense cercariae into an autoclaved 50ml beaker","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ae3ce","text":"Fill the beaker containing cercariae to 45-50ml with diH2O and incubate for   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":56,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":76,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":77,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"itce","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"0432E3D0CFCE11EDBFA34B0A982E49AF","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"F9BE7F90CFCD11EDBFA34B0A982E49AF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7f0tm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70dbe","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"backm","text":"Discard the supernatant and add 5ml 1x PBS + 2% Anti-Anti to the pellet. Gently resuspend by flicking the tube (avoid using pipette because the cercariae are quite sticky and get lost)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":10,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"folvp","text":"IMPORTANT. All the following steps are carried out in the tissue culture biosafety cabinet. Keep a beaker containing 70% ethanol in the cabinet and before discarding any aspirating pipette or serological pipette aspirate ethanol to kill any contaminating cercariae in the pipette.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9avju","text":"Carefully transfer the cercariae to a 50ml Falcon tube and centrifuge at  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":73,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"500","duration":1200,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"4B3EE8A0CFCE11EDBFA34B0A982E49AF","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

steps.section: Cercariae tail removal with micro-emulsifying needle trituration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7plur","text":"Open 8 x 5ml luer-lock syringes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"feuji","text":"Add 45ml 1x PBS + 2% Anti-Anti and centrifuge at  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"500","duration":600,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"56A4A79ECFDE11ED86FF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5vf8s","text":"Repeat this steps 6-7 once more with 1x PBS + 2% Anti-Anti and then twice with somule wash","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2vosi","text":"During the centrifugations in Steps 7 and 8, prepare 2 percoll gradient tubes (2 tube for less than ~150K cercs, 4 tubes every ~150K cercs)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7rlck","text":"Following centrifugation of the cercariae, remove the supernatant and add 5ml of somule wash per percoll gradient you will use","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2s3vo","text":"Vortex for 1 min at max speed. This will start to break off the tails.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cercariae tail removal with micro-emulsifying needle trituration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2fn1v","text":"Of 8 syringes, take out the syringe pump of 4 syringes. Place 4 syringe pumps on 100mm or 150mm petri dish","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cercariae tail removal with micro-emulsifying needle trituration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"50dqr","text":"Lock one intact syringe and one syringe with the pump removed to a sterile 22G micro-emulsifying needle on each side","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cercariae tail removal with micro-emulsifying needle trituration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5abg","text":"Aliquot cercariae equally into the connected needles. Each syringe should hold ~3ml of cercariae","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"auma1","text":"Pass the cerariae suspension thought a 22G blunt-end needle in a luer lock syringe as follows:\n      If 5ml solution – 15 times using 10ml luer lock syringe\n      If 10 ml solution – 30 times using 20ml luer lock syringe","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cercariae tail removal with micro-emulsifying needle trituration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bg5go","text":"Place syringe pumps back into the filled syringes and push the pump all the way. The cercariae should pass through the needle to the opposite syringe\n* Check for any leakage from the locks. If there is a leak, try tightening the lock or do not use that needle ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":150,"length":110}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cercariae tail removal with micro-emulsifying needle trituration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"m8f7","text":"Unlock the empty syringe from the connected needle, place the needle and syringe with cercariae in the 15ml tubes containing the Percoll solution ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lbeb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cercariae tail removal with micro-emulsifying needle trituration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d4tjj","text":"Push the cercariae through the needle, into the tube. Do this for all four needles with max ~5ml per percoll tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lkeq","text":"","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6sb07","text":"Take a drop of cercariae in a petri dish to check under the microscope if the passages have separated the tails. If there are still many cercariae (more than ~20%), continue with ~5 more passages","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bmafi","text":"Place now-headless cercariae carefully on top of Percoll solution tube using a plastic pasteur pipette (5 ml per Percoll solution tube) or directly into the tube of Percoll solution from the syringe","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"22g7j","text":"Remove from centrifuge carefully. Discard supernatant and the white interface of cercaria tails","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e5nd3","text":"Centrifuge at   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":15,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"350","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"11941B86CFE211ED86FF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"acceleration and deceleration =1","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"52o9k","text":"Take schistosomula “pellets” and pool them together in a 15ml falcon tube. Top to 15ml with somule wash","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5cm3e","text":"Centrifuge at   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":15,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"500","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"636C02DCD20111EDB3D70A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4ml98","text":"Discard supernatant and add 15ml somule wash","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eqp52","text":"Repeat washing steps 3 times in total","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5lk34","text":"After the last wash, remove as much supernatant as possible and add 6ml of somule media","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b5vl7","text":"Dispense 2ml of somules into each well of a 6-well plate and add 4ml somule media to each","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"achlj","text":"Incubate at 37°C in 5% CO2 incubator","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":25,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bldbm","text":"The following day observe the somules to look for contamination, and replace media daily","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cercariae tail removal with micro-emulsifying needle trituration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ukio","text":"Push the syringes back and forth 12-13 more times","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cercariae tail removal with micro-emulsifying needle trituration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3kp57","text":"Remove the empty syringe from the connected needle and place the needle and syringe with cercariae in the 15ml tubes containing the Percoll solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Schistosoma mansoni cercariae transformation (with needle)
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"4lfu6","text":"Cercariae are infectious to humans. Please use proper PPE at all times, including a lab coat, waterproof over-gown, long-cuff gloves AQL \u003c=1.5, and face shield.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8fjem","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56vu6","text":"All disposable materials should be placed in biohazardous waste bins","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dajl1","text":"Glassware should be immersed in a klorsept solution of at least 50ppm for at least 2 hours, rinsed with diH2O and then autoclaved","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":107,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17vl","text":"Any liquids should be treated with klorsept solution of at least 50ppm for at least 2 hours","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9f77","text":"Liquids treated with klorsept should be diluted further and disposed in the drain","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qr04","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"664ge","text":"Schistosomula in suspension are not a risk to humans UNLESS they are injected directly into the blood stream. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
